text: Elected officials in the US don’t have the right to demand apologies from their citizens. Proud to see California taking steps so our people can safely cast their ballot. Ensuring our elections are safe and accessible during this pandemic must be a national priority.

My VoteSafe Act is critical to doing that nationwide. https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/08/politics/california-mail-in-voting/index.html

We're seeing the worst economic period since the Great Depression—and families who were already struggling are bearing the brunt of it. 

They need meaningful help like student debt cancellation, increased Social Security benefits, and sustained unemployment benefits.

Our response to this pandemic must recognize an unshakeable truth: Racism, discrimination, and biases have left the Black community in even greater danger during the coronavirus outbreak.
https://features.propublica.org/chicago-first-deaths/covid-coronavirus-took-black-lives-first/

Let me be clear: this crisis may be the worst our country has faced since the Civil War. Congress must take unprecedented and immediate action so people can stay home safely without fear of hunger, illness, or financial ruin. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/09/business/as-job-losses-mount-lawmakers-face-a-make-or-break-moment.html?referringSource=articleShare

RT @RepPressley Our Microbusinesses are the backbones of our communities - our barbershops, beauty salons, and bodegas - and they need help now. 

@SenKamalaHarris and I introduced the #SavingOurStreet Act to get them the relief they need to survive this crisis. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1259214180785192961/pu/img/c_sWENa1htQclb-8.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1259214180785192961/pu/vid/480x270/c25ApbEOV6Ex4TbT.mp4?tag=10

From bodegas to food trucks, we can’t leave behind the micro-businesses that are the lifeblood of our communities. This week I introduced the Saving Our Street Act with @AyannaPressley to do just that. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EXm6rigWoAk74kX.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1259242455985201154/vid/480x270/3FSd68Z3EIIDEoAZ.mp4?tag=13

What must be in the next relief bill:

➡️Guarantee workers continue to receive their paychecks
➡️Universal health coverage
➡️$2,000 monthly payments for all
➡️Fund and protect the United States Postal Service
➡️Ensure relief is accessible to immigrants and the undocumented
Attorney General Bill Barr has corrupted our justice system by acting more like Trump's personal attorney than the nation’s chief law enforcement officer. I'll say it again: Barr must resign.

They are trying to steal another election. It’s all rigged out there. These votes must not count. SCAM!

Tens of millions of people are not only losing their jobs.

They are losing their health insurance. 

We cannot continue to tie your ability to get health care to your employment. 

Medicare for All is a moral imperative.

This crisis has made it painfully clear just how necessary it is that we adopt a universal paid family and sick leave policy. No American worker should ever have to make the choice between their health and their job. #PaidLeaveforAll https://twitter.com/PaidLeaveforAll/status/1257366266656014337 QT @PaidLeaveforAll Thank you to these friends, activists, leaders, and champions who stand with us to say: This is the time for #PaidLeaveforAll. 

Join us. Tell Congress to close the loopholes, cover frontline workers, and protect all of us today. https://paidleaveforall.org/take-action/ http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1257350561663537154/pu/img/vCsFCAuHEIIMoHAd.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1257350561663537154/pu/vid/480x270/OyFWpCQw3LkfZ3K7.mp4?tag=10

Come to Texas!  We would welcome Tesla HQ in Texas. We love jobs & Texans very much want to open up & get back to work (while still staying safe & following sound science). We make lots of cars & trucks in Texas, and we’d love more!! 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸 https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1259162367285317633 QT @elonmusk @GerberKawasaki @thirdrowtesla Frankly, this is the final straw. Tesla will now move its HQ and future programs to Texas/Nevada immediately. If we even retain Fremont manufacturing activity at all, it will be dependen on how Tesla is treated in the future. Tesla is the last carmaker left in CA.

Widespread testing, nationwide contact tracing, public manufacturing. These are health policies—but they’re also economic policies. 

You don’t “reopen” the economy with a tweet. You make a plan and do the work, day after day, to make sure people are safe.

Such a tragic loss for the music industry and for all of us. Andre's genius paved the way for so many of the kings and queens of hip hop and R&B. Sending my love to his family and friends during this difficult time. https://www.essence.com/celebrity/andre-harrell-dead

People in detention facilities are particularly susceptible to the spread of #COVID19—which is why I’ve been calling for ICE to release all vulnerable immigrants under its custody. This is tragic & we must do more to prevent future deaths. https://www.wsj.com/articles/immigrant-detainee-becomes-first-covid-19-casualty-in-ice-facility-11588820475

A $1,200 check ain't enough. We need $2,000 a month, per person, to make America's working families whole. https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2020/05/08/coronavirus-sanders-harris-markey-want-2-000-monthly-payments/3094731001/

America has lost Little Richard, one of the inventors of rock and roll. He was a brilliant performer who broke down barriers and inspired millions of people around the world. Rest in peace. https://twitter.com/npr/status/1259250981046493185 QT @NPR Little Richard was an explosive performer who inspired generations of musicians from Otis Redding to The Beatles to David Bowie. 

He died Saturday morning at 87. 
https://www.npr.org/2020/05/09/523627004/little-richard-obituary?utm_medium=social&utm_term=nprnews&utm_campaign=npr&utm_source=twitter.com

Nothing justifies the shooting of #AhmaudArbery in Georgia. My heart goes out to his family and I hope justice is done. Our criminal justice system needs to do better.
